3503512758.given_title: Why battery costs have plunged 89 percent since 2010
3503512758.resolved_title: Why battery costs have plunged 89 percent since 2010
3503512758.excerpt: The average cost of lithium-ion batteries used in electric cars and other products fell by 6 percent (adjusted for inflation) since last year. Since 2010, these costs have declined by an amazing 89 percent. That’s according to a new report by BloombergNEF.

3882070364.given_title: Why Copper and Nickel Are the Key Metals for Energy Utopia
3882070364.resolved_title: Why Copper and Nickel Are the Key Metals for Energy Utopia
3882070364.excerpt: The raw materials required to transport and store clean energy are critical for the energy transition. Copper and nickel are two such metals. Copper is essential for the transmission and distribution of clean electricity, while nickel powers lithium-ion batteries for EVs and energy storage systems.
